section.title: Part A: Multiple Intelligences
section.subtitle: YOUR NATURAL HARDWARE - Discover how you learn and think best
section.description: Answer based on what comes naturally to you‚Äînot what you've been trained to do.

domains.name: Verbal-Linguistic
domains.description: Word Smart - Reading, writing, speaking, languages

domains.name: Bodily-Kinesthetic
domains.description: Body Smart - Movement, hands-on, physical skills

domains.name: Musical
domains.description: Music Smart - Rhythm, pitch, melody, sound patterns

domains.name: Interpersonal
domains.description: People Smart - Understanding and working with others

domains.name: Intrapersonal
domains.description: Self Smart - Self-awareness, reflection, inner understanding

domains.name: Naturalist
domains.description: Nature Smart - Patterns in nature, environment, living things

questions.text: I enjoy reading books, articles, or stories in my free time.
I like solving puzzles, brainteasers, or logic problems.
I can easily picture things in my mind when I close my eyes.
I learn best when I can move around or use my hands.
I can remember melodies and songs easily.
I find it easy to understand how other people are feeling.
I spend time thinking about my goals and who I want to become.
I enjoy being outdoors and observing nature.
I am good at explaining ideas using words.
I enjoy working with numbers and calculations.
I prefer learning from diagrams, charts, and pictures.
I enjoy sports, dance, or physical activities.
I notice when music is off-key or out of rhythm.
I enjoy working in groups and collaborating with others.
I understand my own strengths and weaknesses well.
I can easily identify different types of plants, animals, or rocks.
I find it easy to learn new languages or vocabulary.
I like to find patterns and logical connections in information.
I am good at reading maps and finding my way around new places.
I find it hard to sit still for long periods.
I often hum, whistle, or tap rhythms without thinking.
People often come to me for advice or to talk about their problems.
I keep a journal or regularly reflect on my experiences.
I am interested in environmental issues and conservation.
I enjoy writing essays, stories, or poems.
I enjoy subjects like math, science, or computer programming.
I enjoy drawing, painting, or creating visual art.
I am good at activities that require coordination (sports, crafts, building).
I enjoy listening to music and can appreciate different styles.
I can easily sense the mood of a room when I walk in.
I prefer working alone rather than in a group.
I like learning about animals, plants, or ecosystems.
I am good at debates, presentations, or public speaking.
I like to analyse situations and think about cause and effect.
I notice visual details that others often miss.
I express myself well through body language or gestures.
I can play a musical instrument or would like to learn.
I am good at resolving conflicts between people.
I know what motivates me and what makes me happy.
I enjoy gardening, hiking, or spending time in nature.
I remember things better when I read them or write them down.
I enjoy strategy games like chess, sudoku, or problem-solving games.
I can easily imagine how a room would look with different furniture.
I learn new physical skills quickly (sports, dance, crafts).
Music affects my mood and emotions strongly.
I enjoy teaching or helping others learn something new.
I think deeply about life's big questions and my place in the world.
I notice changes in weather, seasons, or natural patterns.
I enjoy word games like Scrabble, crosswords, or word puzzles.
I like to understand the "why" behind how things work.
I have a good sense of direction and spatial awareness.
I enjoy hands-on projects like building, cooking, or crafting.
I often have songs or melodies stuck in my head.
I can easily adapt my communication style to different people.
I am good at setting personal goals and following through.
I feel calm and refreshed when I spend time in nature.
I find reading and writing boring.
I avoid math and logical problems when I can.
I struggle to visualise things in my imagination.
I am not very coordinated or athletic.
I don't really pay attention to music or sounds around me.
I find it difficult to understand other people's perspectives.
I rarely think about my own thoughts and feelings.
I am not very interested in nature or the outdoors.
I can express complex ideas clearly in writing.
I enjoy conducting experiments or testing theories.
I am good at assembling things from diagrams or instructions.
I prefer learning by doing rather than by reading or listening.
I can tell the difference between similar musical instruments.
I am good at motivating and encouraging others.
I understand why I react the way I do in different situations.
I am curious about how different species adapt to their environment.
I notice grammar and spelling mistakes easily.
I like categorising and organising information logically.
I can recreate images or designs I have seen before.
I feel restless if I haven't been physically active.
I can easily create or recognise harmonies in music.
I enjoy networking and meeting new people.
I am comfortable being alone with my thoughts.
I enjoy watching nature documentaries or learning about wildlife.

intelligenceInfo.description: Everyone has all 8 intelligences, but we each have a unique combination of strengths.
